South Korea Trade Balance (Jun) 4.17B (Prev. 2.25B)
Brookfield Asset Management agrees to buy Genesee & Wyoming (GWR) for more than USD 110/Shr

PRE-MARKET AUSTRALIAN, JAPANESE AND SOUTH KOREAN STOCK NEWS: CIMIC (CIM AT) units have been chosen as preferred contractors project by Queensland related to delivering the Cross River Rail projec
content:
AUSTRALIA

CIMIC (CIM AT) - Co. units have been chosen as preferred contractors by Queensland related to delivering the Cross River Rail project. (Neswires)

Cromwell Property (CMW AT) - Co. largest shareholder ARA Asset Management is set to increase its stake in the Co. (The Australian)

Flight Centre (FLT AT) - Co. to acquire 3Mundi Corporate. (Newswires)

GBST Holdings (GBT AT) - Co. board is expected to support new bid made by Bravura after the latter raised it to over AUD 3.00/Shr, although there were also reports that Bravura has withdrawn from planning to make an updated proposal for the Co. and reserves the right to make any further offers. (Newswires)

Gold Road Resources (GOR AT) - Co. is to acquire 51% stake in the Cygnus Golds Lake project. (Newswires)

Suncorp (SUN AT) - Co. received representative proceeding filed in new South Wales Supreme Court against its unit Suncorp Portfolio Services Ltd. (Newswires)

Rio Tinto (RIO AST) - Co. appointed Barbara Levi to succeed Philip Richards as Group Executive and General Counsel. (Newswires)

Other News - Australian PM Morrison says the government's income tax cuts could pass both houses of Parliament by as early as Thursday but suggested that this will be just the start and that there will be more than just tax cuts to come. (AFR)

 

JAPAN

Honda (7267 JT) - Co. recalls another 1.6mln vehicles in US to replace Takata (7312 JT) air bag inflators. (Newswires)

Japan Display (6740 JT) - Co. secured USD 150mln of conditional support from Hong Kong’s Oasis. (Nikkei)

J-Front Retailing (3086 JT) - Co. Q1 net JPY 7.45bln vs. Prev. JPY 8.34bln Y/Y, rev. JPY 112.5bln vs. Prev. JPY 111.1bln Y/Y. (Newswires)]

Mazda (7261 JT) - Co. will recall 25K vehicles in US. (Newswires)

Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (8306 JT) - Co. reportedly avoided a substantial loss related to its Indonesia unit. (Newswires)

Oracle Japan (4716 JT) - Co. FY parent net JPY 43.4bln vs. Prev. JPY 38.8bln Y/Y. (Newswires)

SoftBank (9984 JT) - Co. completed transfer of JPY 514bln stake in Yahoo Japan (4689 JT) to unit SoftBank Corp (9434 JT) through a combined share issuance and share buyback deal which resulted in less taxes than a simple sale. (Nikkei)

Sompo Holdings (8630 JT) - Co. will acquire 51% stake in Wellness Communications for JPY 2.0bln. (Newswires)

Other News - Japan is to restrict chip material exports to South Korea amid dispute regarding South Korea’s ruling on wartime forced labor. (Newswires)

 

SOUTH KOREA

Lotte Corp (0049990 KS) - Co. is to sell KRW 229.2bln of card stake to Lotte Shopping. (Newswires)

Yuhan Corp (000100 KS) - Co. signed USD 870mln license-out agreement with Boehringer Ingelheim. (Newswires)

Other News - US President Trump met North Korean leader Kim Jong Un on Sunday and became the first sitting US President to step over to North Korea’s side of the border, while they agreed to resume stalled nuclear talks. The leaders were then briefly joined by South Korean President Moon in the southern side of the border before conducting closed-door discussions.  The meeting followed a Twitter invitation made by President Trump on Saturday to North Korea's Kim Jong Un to meet for a handshake at the Demilitarized Zone. President Trump later described the meeting as very good and very strong in which they agreed to work out details and added that “we’ll see what can happen”. (Newswires)

subject: UK Foreign Secretary and PM candidate Hunt announces a GBP 20bln no-deal Brexit war chest to support industries

British Chambers of Commerce says balance of UK manufacturing firms that have reported improved domestic orders is at a 7-year low, adds modest pick up in US service sector for Q2 is insufficient to offset significant decline in Q1
Australian CBA Manufacturing PMI (Jun F) 52.0 (Prev. 51.7)
Israeli warplanes fired missiles on Syria military positions in Homs and outskirts of Damascus from Lebanese airspace, according to SANA reports citing a military source
Japan is to restrict chip material exports to South Korea
US equity futures gap higher at the open with Emini S&P up by around 1% following the US-China trade truce, as well as President Trump's meeting with North Korea Leader Kim at the demilitarized zone
content: • As such, T-notes are lower by 12 ticks and gold has declined 1.4% to below USD 1400/oz on safe haven outflows, while WTI is up more than 2% on the risk appetite as well as reports Russia and Saudi agreed to extend the output cut deal.

subject: ASIAN DAILY ECONOMIC RELEASES CALENDAR NOW AVAILABLE IN THE RESEARCH SECTION: Highlights include BoJ Tankan, Regional PMIs including Chinese Caixin Manufacturing PMI, Fed's Clarida Speech
Reports note military strikes and explosions heard to the west of Damascus, Syria
Iraq Oil Minister says prices are on the low side and that USD 70+ is a good price
Iraq Oil Minister says we have an open mind on oil output deal extension, but says its too early to say regarding deeper cuts
North Korea Leader Kim and US President Trump agreed to resume and push forward productive dialogues for a fresh breakthrough in the denuclearization of the peninsula
DAILY ASIA-PAC OPENING NEWS
content:
ASIA-PAC

US agreed to not levy new tariffs on Chinese goods following the Trump-Xi meeting at the G20, while the sides agreed to restart trade talks. Furthermore, US President Trump stated the he had an excellent meeting with Xi which was as good as it was going to be and thinks US is “back on track" with China. (Newswires)

  • Chinese Manufacturing PMI (Jun) 49.4 vs. Exp. 49.5 (Prev. 49.4). (Newswires)
  • Chinese Non-Manufacturing PMI (Jun) 54.2 (Prev. 54.3)
  • Chinese Composite PMI (Jun) 53.0 (Prev. 53.3)

 

  • BoJ announces its monthly JGB purchase intentions. (Newswires)
  • JPY 100bln-250bln in 10-25yr JGBs 3 times (Prev. JPY 100bln-300bln 3 times)
  • JPY 250bln-500bln in 3-5yr JGBs 4 times (Prev. JPY 300bln-500bln 4 times)
  • JPY 200bln-500bln in 1-3yr JGBs 4 times (Prev. JPY 250bln-450bln. 4 times)

 

UK/EU

ECB's Villeroy stated that the inflation rate is too low in the EZ and there is too much uncertainty over the future, which is why we are maintaining active monetary policy with favorable financing conditions. (Newswires)

Fitch affirmed Sweden at 'AAA'; Outlook Stable. (Newswires)

  • UK GDP (Q1) Q/Q 0.5% vs. Exp. 0.5% (Prev. 0.5%). (Newswires)
  • UK GDP (Q1) Y/Y 1.8% vs. Exp. 1.8% (Prev. 1.8%)

 

FX

Bank of Canada Q2 Business Outlook Survey noted a slight improvement in business sentiment, while hiring and investment sentiment remained healthy. Furthermore, following some softness in past sales, businesses expect an increase in sales growth in the next 12 months backed by healthy domestic and foreign demand. (Newswires)

Canadian GDP MM (Apr) 0.3% vs. Exp. 0.1% (Prev. 0.5%). (Newswires) 

 

COMMODITIES

Baker Hughes oil rigs +4 at 793, nat gas rigs -4 at 173, total rigs unchanged at 967; US drillers add oil rigs for the second week in a row. (Newswires)

Russia and Saudi Arabia agreed to extend the OPEC+ output deal in which Russian President Putin said will be extended by 6 to 9 months. As a reminder, there were reports on Friday that OPEC are set to extend their oil production cut in H2 at its upcoming meeting with some set to argue for deeper cuts although Saudi is unlikely to back such a move. (WSJ)

Russian Energy Minister Novak said on Friday that Russia's oil output will be cut slightly more in June than seen by OPEC+ pact, while he commented over the weekend that agreement to extend the oil cut deal is consolidated and other countries are backing an extension. (IFX/Newswires)

EU Statement said Iran nuclear deal remains key element of global nuclear non-proliferation and that a special EU channel to allow trade with Iran and circumvent US sanctions is now operational. (Newswires)

US Special Representative on Iran Hook said Iran has rejected diplomacy too many times and that sanctions will be imposed on any illicit purchase of Iranian oil. (Newswires)

 

GEOPOLITICS

US President Trump met North Korean leader Kim Jong Un on Sunday and became the first sitting US President to step over to North Korea’s side of the border, while they agreed to resume stalled nuclear talks. The leaders were then briefly joined by South Korean President Moon in the southern side of the border before conducting closed-door discussions.  The meeting followed a Twitter invitation made by President Trump on Saturday to North Korea's Kim Jong Un to meet for a handshake at the Demilitarized Zone. President Trump later described the meeting as very good and very strong in which they agreed to work out details and added that “we’ll see what can happen”. (Newswires)

Turkey President Erdogan said he has heard from US President Trump that there will be no sanctions regarding the S400 missile defence system deal with Russia. (Newswires)

 

US

Fed's Kaplan (Non-Voter) stated that growth has been more sluggish and that it is too soon to change the stance of monetary policy, while he added that he would need to see a more substantial deterioration in outlook before backing a rate cut and reiterated that the shape of the yield curve signals uncertainty. (Newswires)

  • US Personal Income (May) M/M 0.5% vs. Exp. 0.3% (Prev. 0.5%). (Newswires)
  • US Core PCE Price Index MM (May) 0.2% vs. Exp. 0.2% (Prev. 0.2%)
  • US Core PCE Price Index YY (May) 1.6% vs. Exp. 1.6% (Prev. 1.6%)
  • US Chicago PMI (Jun) 49.7 vs. Exp. 53.1 (Prev. 54.2)

 

MARKET RECAP

Financials were outperforming on Friday following all the major US banks having their capital spending plans approved by the Fed on the back of successful stress tests. Apple (AAPL) weighed on indices after its Chief Designer announced his departure. Nike (NKE) drifted lower on the back of its earnings, where it beat on revenue but missed on EPS, in addition to some lacklustre revenue guidance for the next quarter. Constellation Brands (STZ) had a star reaching earnings report, topping both EPS and revenue estimates as well as guidance expectations. Raytheon (RTN) underperformed as investor Daniel Loeb joined with Bill Ackman to oppose the United Technologies (UTX) merger. Proctor & Gamble (PG) opened higher on an upgrade at Goldman, whilst Biogen (BIIB) opened lower with gratitude to a downgrade at Piper Jaffray. S&P 500 0.6% AT 2941, NASDAQ-100 0.2% AT 7671, DOW JONES 0.3% AT 26596.

Anticipation around the meeting between President Trump and Xi overnight has kept trading cautious on Friday, which was also the last trading day before month/quarter/H1 end. The Treasury curve was mixed, but yields only deviated by around +/- 1bps at settlement, with major curve spreads little changed. US T-note futures (U9) settled 1 tick higher at 127-31.
